newsitem.title: USA: Western Resources to pursue security sector.
newsitem.headline: Western Resources to pursue security sector.

text.p: Western Resources Inc chief executive officer John Hayes said Thursday that the company remains interested in expanding its presence in the electronic security industry.
His statement came as Western is holding settlement talks about the potential termination of its $3.5 billion hostile takeover bid for electronic security giant ADT Ltd.
Hayes declined to comment on the status of those settlement talks, which were disclosed earlier this month by ADT in a filing with the U.S. Securities and Exchange Commission.

"I'm not going to say anything more than I've already said with regard to our ownership of ADT and our bid for the company. Regardless of that, we continue to have an interest in growing our presence in the security business," Hayes said at Western's annual meeting.

Western already holds a 27 percent stake in ADT and launched an unsolicited takeover of the company in December. ADT rejected the bid as financially inadequate and entered a friendly $5.4 billion transaction with Tyco International Ltd.
Western struck a deal last December to buy the security business of Westinghouse Electric Corp for $368 million.
